body_html:
Then it definitely will be several times larger and the factor depends on how well JPEG works on your images. The factor is 5.x on the whole ImageNet, btw (reference).
TFRecord stores bytes so you can do any encoding you want.
body_text:
Then it definitely will be several times larger and the factor depends on how well JPEG works on your images. The factor is 5.x on the whole ImageNet, btw (reference).
TFRecord stores bytes so you can do any encoding you want.
body:
Then it definitely will be several times larger and the factor depends on how well JPEG works on your images. The factor is 5.x on the whole ImageNet, btw ([reference](https://github.com/ppwwyyxx/tensorpack/issues/124#issuecomment-277206505)).
TFRecord stores bytes so you can do any encoding you want.
